page.title: 02The Growth of Ulverston
page.content: Ulverston is an{old market town}with buildings dating from the 17th cent- ury. The oldest were built around the junction of two streams;many have been demolished to accommodate a car park. Development of{small industries, such as the brewery and the mill,attr- acted more people to the town,and housing developed north and south. The{canal}(1796) and{railway}(1857) led to more housing for the workers; there are many pre-war houses situated around South Ulverston. This is now an industrial site with factories like Glaxo. A modern housing estate,Croft- lands,was built after World War Two with council and private estates.There are also modern buildings dotted around the town,such as the Library and Job Centre. Development is contin- uing,renovating the older areas and building new ones.
